question:
The bar graph given below shows the sales of ball pens (in thousand numbers) from six shops S1, S2, S3, S4, S5, and S6, during two consecutive years, 2011 and 2012.

What’s is the ratio of the total sales of shop S2 for both years to the total sales of Shop S5 for both years?


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1750331707502_image001.png
solution:
Total sales of shop S2= 90+70=160

Total sales of shop S5= 80+60=140

Ratio

160 : 140

8:7

question:
The given pie chart shows the number of students admitted in to different classes of a school in the academic year 2022-23.

How many students were more in Class 10 than in Class 12 if 600 students were admitted in to Class 8?


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1750331707502_image002.png
solution:
Students in class 8 = 15%

Students in class 10 = 25%

Students in class 12 = 18%

15%=600

1%=40

Therefore,

25%-18%=7%

7×40= 280

280 students are more in class 10 than in class 12

question:
The pie-chart below shows the expenditures (in ₹ lakh) of a country on various sports during a particular year. Study the graph carefully and answer the question given below it.

What is the average expenditure (in ₹ lakh) on tennis, golf, swimming, and basketball, if the expenditure on cricket is ₹72 lakh?


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1750331707502_image003.png
solution:
Expenditure on cricket= 60°

60°= 72 lakh

1°= 1.2 lakh

Total expenditure on tennis, golf, swimming, and basketball= 85°+48°+45°+52°= 230°

Average expenditure = 230°÷4

= 57.5°

Therefore,

Average expenditure = 57.5×1.2

= 69

The given bar graph shows the number of students enrolled in Institutes A and B during 5 years (2018 to 2022).

What is the ratio of the total students enrolled in Institute B in 2019, 2020 and 2022 to that of the total students enrolled in Institute A in 2018, 2020 and 2021?


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1750331707502_image021.png
solution:
Total students enrolled in Institute B in 2019, 2020 and 2022 = 350 + 375 +200 = 925

Total students enrolled in Institute A in 2018, 2020 and 2021 = 150 + 300 + 250 = 700

Ratio = 925 : 700 = 37 : 28
